subject: Re: [junit] Please someone proide me a solution for this problem in 	JUnit
msgSnippet: Dilip, In certain cases, Eclipse will run every method whose name starts with test , regardless of whether you have a suite() method.  What behavior are you
messageBody:
Dilip,

In certain cases, Eclipse will run every method whose name starts with
"test", regardless of whether you have a suite() method. What
behavior are you hoping for?

David

On Thu, Mar 25, 2010 at 1:10 AM, Dilip <dilip.thelip@...> wrote:
> Hi my name is dilip,
> I got a problem while executing junit test cases.
> I got a project named JUnit in eclipse.I hav got many modules in that eclipse and i am writing junits for those modules.
> Once i create a junit test case.The general procedure is to execute it calling methods inside the static block.
> public static Test suite(){
> }
> The problem i am facing now is :
> -Methods getting called without executing public static test suite() block.
> -Even if i remove the public static test suite() block the methods are getting executed and am gettint the output.
> -Even if i run the junit as code coverage option.The public static test suite() block in junit test case is not covered.
> -In eclipse platform i hav chosen junit3.
> -some one please give me a solution.
>
>
>
>
